tit.e: Senji ryakketsu (占事略决) (the summary to judgements of divinations)
Senji ryakketsu (占事略决) (the summary of judgments of divinations)
Senji ryakketsu (占事略决) (the summary of judgments of divinations)

sen.j: 占事略决 (せんじりゃっけつ、せんじりゃくけつ) は、平安時代の陰陽師・安倍晴明が撰したとされる、現存最古の陰陽道に関する書物である。
sen.e: Senji ryakketsu (or Senji ryakuketsu) is the oldest existent book of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) which is believed to have been compiled by Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) ABE no Seimei in the Heian period.

Senji ryakketsu (or Senji ryakuketsu) is the oldest existent book of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; an occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) which is believed to have been compiled by Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) ABE no Seimei in the Heian period.

"Senji ryakketsu" (or "Senji ryakuketsu") is the oldest existent book of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; an occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) which is believed to have been compiled by Onmyoji (Master of Yin yang) ABE no Seimei in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Senji ryakketsu Senji ryakuketsu書名であり、且つ以降の文章に説明がなされていることから、ダブルコーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: 『占事略決』とも書かれる。
sen.e: Senji ryakketsu is also written in Chinese characters as "占事略決".
Senji ryakketsu is also written in Chinese characters as "占事略決".
Senji ryakketsu is also written in Chinese characters as "占事略決".

sen.j: これは毛筆による筆跡では决と決の判別が困難なことがあり、翻刻時の判断で决か決が決まってしまうことによる。
sen.e: Because it is difficult to discern the difference between "决" and "决"from the handwriting of brush, whether"决" or "决" depends on the judgment of persons who made transcripts.
Because it is difficult to discern the difference between "决" and "决"from handwriting made with a brush, whether"决" or "决" is used depends on the judgment of persons who made transcripts.
Because it is difficult to discern the difference between "决" and "决"from handwriting made with a brush, whether"决" or "决" is used depends on the judgment of persons who made transcripts.

sen.j: ただし、いくつかの写本では表題として明確に占事略决の表記が採用されており、最も入手しやすい村山1981でもそれにならっていることから、これが一般的な表記となっている。
sen.e: However, "占事略决" is the commonly used title as the titles of some transcripts can be clearly discerned and the most easily available Murayama 1981 also followed suit.
However, "占事略决" is the commonly used title, as the titles of some transcripts can be clearly discerned, and the most easily available Murayama 1981 also followed suit.

However, "占事略决" is the commonly used title, as the titles of some transcripts can be clearly discerned, and the most easily available "Nihon Onmyodoshi Sosetsu" by Shuichi MURAYAMA also followed suit.
sen.cmt: Murayama1981を"Nihon Onmyodoshi Sosetsu" by Shuichi MURAYAMA に修正しました。

sen.j: 『占事略决』は、撰者である安倍晴明の没年が『尊卑分脈』によれば1005年とされているので、それ以前に成立したと考えられる。
sen.e: "Senji ryakketsu" is believed to have been compiled before ? because, according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), the author ABE no Seimei' s year of death was ?.
sen.cmt: ？ の箇所は年号が入ると思われますが、原文で欠落しておりますので、？としております。
sen.e: "Senji ryakketsu" is believed to have been compiled before ? because, according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), the author ABE no Seimei' s year of death was ?.

"Senji ryakketsu" is believed to have been compiled before 1005 because, according to "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), the author ABE no Seimei' s year of death was 1005.
sen.cmt: 安倍晴明の没年（1005年）を原文訳文双方に追記しました。出典：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%AE%89%E5%80%8D%E6%99%B4%E6%98%8E

sen.j: 京都大学附属図書館所蔵の写本の奥書によると、晴明が『占事略决』を撰したのは“天元六年”（983年）である。
sen.e: According to the okugaki (postscript) of the transcript possessed by The Kyoto University Library, Seimei compiled "Senji ryakketsu" in 983.
sen.cmt: 原文では年号が欠落しておりますが、次の欄に『天元六年』とありますので、その西暦表示を入れております。
sen.e: According to the okugaki (postscript) of the transcript possessed by The Kyoto University Library, Seimei compiled "Senji ryakketsu" in 983.
According to the okugaki (postscript) of the transcript possessed by The Kyoto University Library, Seimei compiled "Senji ryakketsu" in 983.
sen.cmt: 原文「撰したのはである」に「“天元六年”（983年）」を追記しました。※年号が欠落していたため、ウィキペディアの原文を参照しました。

sen.j: ただし奥書において『天元六年』には『歳次己卯』が付せられており、この干支によれば979年（天元2年）である。
sen.e: Provided, however, that the above is only based on "歳次己卯" of the Oriental zodiac that was appended to "天元六年" in okugaki.
sen.cmt: 歳次己卯 - 定訳、読み不明
sen.e: Provided, however, that the above is based only on "歳次己卯" of the Oriental zodiac that was appended to "天元六年" in okugaki.
However, in okugaki, "歳次己卯" is appended to the year; thus according to the Oriental zodiac, it is in 979.
sen.cmt: 原文「これは干支によればである」に「979年（天元2年）」を追記しました。※年号が欠落していたため、ウィキペディアの原文を参照しました。また、この追記に伴い、全文を修正しました。

sen.j: いずれにしても現存する写本は鎌倉時代以降のものである。
sen.e: At any rate, the oldest existent transcript was made in the Kamakura Period or later.
At any rate, the oldest existent transcript was made in the Kamakura Period or later.
At any rate, the oldest existent transcript was made in the Kamakura period or later.
sen.cmt: Period を period に修正しました。

sen.j: 『占事略决』の内容は、六壬神課と呼ばれる占術の基本的な説明と、六壬神課による占い方の占う目的ごとの解説である。
sen.e: The contents of "Senji ryakketsu" are the basic explanation of divination called Rikujinshainka and the explanation concerning tha way of divination for each purpose.
The contents of "Senji ryakketsu" are a basic explanation of divination called Rikujinshainka and an explanation concerning the way of divination for each purpose.
The contents of "Senji ryakketsu" are a basic explanation of divination called Rikujinshinka and an explanation concerning the way of divination by Rikujinshinka for each purpose.
sen.cmt: Rokujinshainka を Rikujinshinka に修正しました。「六壬神課による」訳漏れのため、by Rikujinshinka を追記しました。

sen.j: 『四課三伝法第一』を巻頭に、占うにあたっての手続きから解説が始まる。
sen.e: With "Shikasandenho Daiich" being at the beginning of book, the explanation starts with the procedures of divination
sen.cmt: 四課三伝法第一 - 定訳、読み不明
sen.e: With "Shikasandenho Daiich" being at the beginning of the book, the explanation starts with the procedures of divination
With "Shikasandenho Daiich" being at the beginning of the book, the explanation starts with the procedures of divination.
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドを追記しました。

sen.j: 六壬神課は式占術の一つであり、太乙神数、奇門遁甲と合わせて「三式」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Rikujinshinka (an ancient form of divination from China based on astronomy and Kanshijutsu (Oriental zodiac)) is one of Shikisenjutsu (an ancient form of divination from China that uses a board called Shikiban and a spoon-like tool called Choku), and along with Taiitsushinsu (one of the divinations that was invented in China and mainly cast about important matters such as politics and economy) and Kimontonko (an ancient form of divination from China which is still in use in China, Taiwan, Singapore and the Chinese diasporas in Southeast Asia), they are collectively called "Sanshiki".

Rikujinshinka (an ancient form of divination from China based on astronomy and Kanshijutsu (Oriental zodiac)) is one type of of Shikisenjutsu (an ancient form of divination from China that uses a board called Shikiban and a spoon-like tool called a Choku), and, along with Taiitsushinsu (one of the divinations that was invented in China and mainly cast about important matters such as politics and economics) and Kimontonko (an ancient form of divination from China which is still in use in China, Taiwan, Singapore, and the Chinese diasporas in Southeast Asia), they are collectively called "Sanshiki."

sen.cmt: one type of of Shikisenjutsu のof を一つ削除しました。"Sanshiki" を'Sanshiki' に修正しました。

sen.j: 六壬神課は、平安時代から鎌倉時代にかけて、陰陽寮に所属する陰陽師にとって必須の占術とされた。
sen.e: During the Heian and Kamakura period, Rikujinshinka was regarded as the essential divination for Ommyoji (Master of Yin yang) belonged to Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination).
During the Heian and Kamakura periods, Rikujinshinka was regarded as the essential divination for Ommyoji (Master of Yin yang) belonging to Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination).
During the Heian and Kamakura periods, Rikujinshinka was regarded as the essential divination for Ommyoji belonging to Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination).
sen.cmt: (Master of Yin yang) は既出のため削除しました。

sen.j: 朝廷から変事の吉凶等について、陰陽寮に諮問があった際、六壬神課で占った結果が六壬勘文の形で報告された。
sen.e: When inquired by the Imperial court about the fortune of accidents, Onmyoryo reported the results of Rikujinshinka in the form of Rikujin Kanmon (a form of the report of the divination practiced by Onmyoji).

When inquired by the Imperial court about the fortune of accidents, Onmyoryo reported the results of Rikujinshinka in the form of Rikujin Kanmon (a form of report of the divination practiced by Onmyoji).

When inquired by the Imperial court about the fortune of accidents, Onmyoryo reported the results of Rikujinshinka in the form of Rikujin Kanmon (a form of report of the divination practiced by Onmyoji).

sen.j: この六壬勘文の幾つかは現存しており、安倍晴明による六壬勘文も残っている。
sen.e: Some Rikujin Kanmon, including that of Abe no Seimei, are existent.
Some Rikujin Kanmon, including that of Abe no Seimei, still exist.
Some Rikujin Kanmon, including that of ABE no Seimei, still exist.
sen.cmt: Abe を ABE に修正しました。

sen.j: 『占事略决』について諸説あるが、安倍家における家伝を背景として、六壬神課について簡略に解説した書籍であり、中世陰陽道の研究に必須の文献資料 (歴史学)と解される。
sen.e: Though there are various theories on "Senji ryakketsu", it is regarded as the indispensible documentary records (history) for the study of medieval Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) since it briefly explained Rikujinshinka based on the family tradition of the Abe family.

Though there are various theories on "Senji ryakketsu," it is regarded indispensible documentary records (history) for the study of medieval Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), since it briefly explains Rikujinshinka based on the tradition of the Abe family.

Though there are various theories on "Senji ryakketsu," it is regarded indispensable documentary records (history) for the study of medieval Onmyodo, since it briefly explains Rikujinshinka based on the tradition of the Abe family.
sen.cmt: indispensible をindispensable に修正しました。(way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) は既出のため削除しました。

sen.j: 最古の写本は、安倍晴明から11代後の子孫である安倍泰統 (あべ たいとう) が、鎌倉時代に書写した尊経閣文庫蔵本である。
sen.e: The oldest existent transcript is the book posessed by Sonkeikaku-bunko (a library of the Kaga Maeda family), which was transcribed by Abe no taito, the 11th descendant of Abe no Seimei, in the Kamakura Period.

sen.cmt: posessed をpossessed に修正しました。Abe を ABE に修正しました。taito をTaito に修正しました。Period をperiod に修正しました。

sen.j: 村山1981には、尊経閣文庫蔵本から全文を翻刻し、独自の校訂を加えた本文が収載されている。
sen.e: In Murayama 1981, the text which was reprinted from the transcript possessed by Sonkeikaku-bunko with unique revision added is compiled.

sen.e: Other than the above, the transcript possessed by Imperial Household Archives, the transcript possessed by Kyoto Prefectural Library and Archives and the transcript possessed by The Kyoto University Library are existent.

sen.e: While the the description of the opening paragraph of the transcript possessed by The Kyoto University Library is "常以月将加占事", that of the transcripts possessed by Sonkeikaku-bunko and Imperial Household Archives is " 常以月将加占時".

sen.j: 泰統は晴明から11代の子孫であるが、『尊卑分脈』によると泰統自身は陰陽師の役職に就いていない。
sen.e: According to ""Sonpi Bunmyaku", Taito himself was not Onmyoji though he was the 11th descendant of Seimei.

sen.j: 奥書では泰統が書写した年は貞応6年とされているが、実際には貞応は3年までしかない。
sen.e: According to okugaki, Taito transcribed in 貞応6年 (the sixth year of Teio era (1227)), but actually, Teio era lasted only until 貞応3年 (the third year of Teio era (1224)).

sen.j: このことから貞応元年の誤記ではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered that the author mistook 貞応6年 for 貞応元年 (the first year of Teio (1222)).

sen.e: Murakami 1981, which asserted on one hand that the author mistook 貞応6年 for 正応6年 (the sixth year of Shoo era (1293)), eventually concluded that the year in which the transcript posessed by Sonkeikaku-bunko was written was unknown.

sen.j: この写本は、江戸時代初期のに、安倍家の当主であった安倍泰福（あべ やすとみ）によって、加賀藩の藩主であった前田氏に献上された。

sen.j: そのため本書は、加賀藩主前田家の文庫であった尊経閣文庫に所蔵され、それを引き継いだ前田育徳会が管理する尊経閣文庫に伝わった。
sen.e: Accordingly, this transcript has been possessed by Sonkeikaku-bunko, which was initially the library of the lord of Kaga clan Maeda family and is managed by Maeda Ikutokukai at present.
